title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: No, hold on, is it a bit before? – I find that bit of Colinton Road a bit confusing. I suppose it depends on whether you're coming from the direction of town or from the other direction, you know, the road which goes up to Redford and to Merchiston Castle School.

title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "My wife bumped into her, actually, a few times at the Colinton tennis courts. You know the ones just off the Colinton Road, just after that Mercedes garage. No, hold on, is it a bit before?

title: The Importance of Being Seven
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: That was very important, as  Watsonians recognised the display of this boat as conferring  membership of the group. Indeed, above Watsonian headquarters,  a long, low, classical building on Colinton Road, an ironwork  boat dominated a prominent weather-vane, thus signalling to any

title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They began to walk again, turning down a narrow street that would bring them out onto Colinton Road. A cat ran ahead of them, having appeared from beneath a parked car, and then shot off into a garden.

title: The Right Attitude to Rain
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She turned the corner and started to walk down her road. Walking towards her, having just parked his car in the street, was one of the students who attended lectures in Colinton Road nearby. Isabel caught his eye as they passed.

title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Matthew stopped. They had reached the edge of Colinton Road and his voice was drowned by the sound of a passing car.
